results.title: Adam and Eve
results.brief_description: An animated film using abstract cutouts, symbolising life, reproduction, growth and destruction from creation to the end of the world in an explosion, then the beginning of a new cycle.

results.title: Action stations
results.creator_credit: Gil Brealey, Kip Porteous and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: Experimental film which brings alive a small boy’s dream as he wanders to the Sydney Harbour waterfront and imagines life on a “mothball” warship. Without commentary, but with clever use of sound the warship resounds to the cry of “Action Stations”, the sound of running feet, firing, vibrations and cheers echo through the empty ship. Finally the ship’s flag is run up and the dream ends with his mother calling him home.

results.title: Action loop
results.creator_credit: Dudley Robinson, Filmpartnership and Melbourne Underground Rail Loop Authority
results.brief_description: Shows the progress being made in the construction of the underground rail loop in the city of Melbourne. The four tunnels will link five stations at Flinders Street, Parliament, the Museum, Flagstaff and Spencer Street, thus relieving the present strain on the city’s transport system. Although much work is yet to be completed - overhead wiring, retaining walls, rails to be laid - by the early 1980’s, Melbourne will be a modern transport system city. Narrated by Michael Pate. Photographed by Dudley Robinson.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dudley Robinson, Filmpartnership and Melbourne Underground Rail Loop Authority
